card.name: Acid-Spewer Dragon
card.text: Flying, deathtouch\nMegamorph {5}{B}{B} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)\nWhen Acid-Spewer Dragon is turned face up, put a +1/+1 counter on each other Dragon creature you control.

card.name: Aerie Bowmasters
card.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)\nMegamorph {5}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

card.name: Ainok Artillerist
card.text: Ainok Artillerist has reach as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it. (It can block creatures with flying.)

appearance.flavor: "In the Tarkir I once knew, the Abzan revered their ancestor trees. Now, as Dromoka, they cut their finest groves to make weapons."\n—Sarkhan Vol

card.name: Ainok Survivalist
card.text: Megamorph {1}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)\nWhen Ainok Survivalist is turned face up, destroy target artifact or enchantment an opponent controls.

card.name: Ambuscade Shaman
card.text: Whenever Ambuscade Shaman or another creature enters the battlefield under your control, that creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.\nDash {3}{B} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)

card.name: Anafenza, Kin-Tree Spirit
card.text: Whenever another nontoken creature enters the battlefield under your control, bolster 1. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

appearance.flavor: Martyred for worshipping her ancestors, she now walks among them.

card.name: Ancestral Statue
card.text: When Ancestral Statue enters the battlefield, return a nonland permanent you control to its owner's hand.

appearance.flavor: The mage awakened the statue in hopes of learning the lost lore of her clan, but the statue was interested only in war.
"Why eat now what could one day grow into a feast?"\n—Ojutai, translated from Draconic

card.name: Anticipate
card.text: Look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

appearance.flavor: "When I have meditated on all outcomes, my opponent has no recourse."

card.name: Arashin Foremost
card.text: Double strike\nWhenever Arashin Foremost enters the battlefield or attacks, another target Warrior creature you control gains double strike until end of turn.

appearance.flavor: "I would gladly give my life if it would inspire my clan to victory."

card.name: Arashin Sovereign
card.text: Flying\nWhen Arashin Sovereign dies, you may put it on the top or bottom of its owner's library.

appearance.flavor: Dromoka dragons foster trust among their subjects, while the other clans must spend their time quelling rebellion.

card.name: Artful Maneuver
card.text: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.\nRebound (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. At the beginning of your next upkeep, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

card.name: Assault Formation
card.text: Each creature you control assigns combat damage equal to its toughness rather than its power.\n{G}: Target creature with defender can attack this turn as though it didn't have defender.\n{2}{G}: Creatures you control get +0/+1 until end of turn.

card.name: Atarka Beastbreaker
card.text: Formidable — {4}{G}: Atarka Beastbreaker gets +4/+4 until end of turn. Activate this ability only if creatures you control have total power 8 or greater.

appearance.flavor: He scorns the heavy winter garb of lesser warriors, trusting his anger to keep him warm.

card.name: Atarka Efreet
card.text: Megamorph {2}{R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)\nWhen Atarka Efreet is turned face up, it deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

card.name: Atarka Monument
card.text: {T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool.\n{4}{R}{G}: Atarka Monument becomes a 4/4 red and green Dragon artifact creature with flying until end of turn.

appearance.flavor: Atarka is worshipped and fed by her subjects at Ayagor, the Dragon's Bowl.

card.name: Atarka Pummeler
card.text: Formidable — {3}{R}{R}: Each creature you control can't be blocked this turn except by two or more creatures. Activate this ability only if creatures you control have total power 8 or greater.

card.name: Atarka's Command
card.text:
Choose two —
• Your opponents can't gain life this turn.
• Atarka's Command deals 3 damage to each opponent.
• You may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield.
• Creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain reach until end of turn.

card.name: Avatar of the Resolute
card.text: Reach, trample\nAvatar of the Resolute enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each other creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it.

appearance.flavor: It exemplifies the ideals of the Dromoka: strength, unity, and honor.

card.name: Aven Sunstriker
card.text: Flying\nDouble strike (This creature deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)\nMegamorph {4}{W} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

card.name: Aven Tactician
card.text: Flying\nWhen Aven Tactician enters the battlefield, bolster 1. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

appearance.flavor: The aven are admired, for they are able to fly with the dragons.

card.name: Battle Mastery
card.text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature has double strike. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)

appearance.flavor: "There is elegance in all the Ojutai do—even their killing."\n—Kirada, Silumgar enforcer

card.name: Belltoll Dragon
card.text: Flying, hexproof\nMegamorph {5}{U}{U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)\nWhen Belltoll Dragon is turned face up, put a +1/+1 counter on each other Dragon creature you control.

card.name: Berserkers' Onslaught
card.text: Attacking creatures you control have double strike.

appearance.flavor: "Atarka's people starve while she feasts upon the bounty of their hunts. They must conquer ever more lands just for the sake of their own subsistence."\n—Arel, Unseen Whisperer

card.name: Blessed Reincarnation
card.text: Exile target creature an opponent controls. That player reveals cards from the top of his or her library until a creature card is revealed. The player puts that card onto the battlefield, then shuffles the rest into his or her library.\nRebound (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. At the beginning of your next upkeep, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

card.name: Blood-Chin Fanatic
card.text: {1}{B}, Sacrifice another Warrior creature: Target player loses X life and you gain X life, where X is the sacrificed creature's power.

appearance.flavor: "We are as brutal as our dragonlord. We strike like wild lightning and feast on human flesh."

card.name: Blood-Chin Rager
card.text: Whenever Blood-Chin Rager attacks, each Warrior creature you control can't be blocked this turn except by two or more creatures.

appearance.flavor: Kolaghan blades rarely stay clean for long.

card.name: Boltwing Marauder
card.text: Flying\nWhenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

appearance.flavor: When battling the Kolaghan, consider yourself lucky if lightning strikes the same place only twice.

card.name: Butcher's Glee
card.text: Target creature gets +3/+0 and gains lifelink until end of turn. Regenerate it. (Damage dealt by a creature with lifelink also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

appearance.flavor: The Crave made Kneecleaver think she was bigger than the dragon.

card.name: Center Soul
card.text: Target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.\nRebound (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. At the beginning of your next upkeep, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

card.name: Champion of Arashin
card.text: Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

appearance.flavor: "The blood of Dromoka and the blood of my veins are the same."

card.name: Circle of Elders
card.text: Vigilance\nFormidable — {T}: Add {3} to your mana pool. Activate this ability only if creatures you control have total power 8 or greater.

appearance.flavor: They whisper of an ancient hero who saved the dragons of their world.

card.name: Clone Legion
card.text: For each creature target player controls, put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of that creature.

appearance.flavor: Their lust for battle was so great that they didn't care their enemies wore their own faces.

card.name: Coat with Venom
card.text: Target creature gets +1/+2 and gains deathtouch until end of turn. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

appearance.flavor: "Every Silumgar blade carries the blessing of our dragonlord."\n—Xathi the Infallible

card.name: Collected Company
card.text: Look at the top six cards of your library. Put up to two creature cards with converted mana cost 3 or less from among them onto the battlefield. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

appearance.flavor: Many can stand where one would fall.
The colossodon's hard outer shell stops many predators, but with a gentle flip from a dragon, it quickly becomes a meal in a bowl.

card.name: Commune with Lava
card.text: Exile the top X cards of your library. Until the end of your next turn, you may play those cards.

appearance.flavor: Atarka conquered Qadat, the Fire Rim, long ago, winning over its efreet with a promise to spread the glory of fire to all the world.

card.name: Conifer Strider
card.text: Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

appearance.flavor: Atarka's presence thaws the glaciers of Qal Sisma, forcing its elementals to migrate or adapt.

card.name: Contradict
card.text: Counter target spell.\nDraw a card.

appearance.flavor: Those who question Ojutai may not like the answers they receive.

card.name: Corpseweft
card.text: {1}{B}, Exile one or more creature cards from your graveyard: Put an X/X black Zombie Horror creature token onto the battlefield tapped, where X is twice the number of cards exiled this way.

appearance.flavor: Sidisi hated to limit her options.

card.name: Crater Elemental
card.text: {R}, {T}, Sacrifice Crater Elemental: Crater Elemental deals 4 damage to target creature.\nFormidable — {2}{R}: Crater Elemental has base power 8 until end of turn. Activate this ability only if creatures you control have total power 8 or greater.

card.name: Cunning Breezedancer
card.text: Flying\nWhenever you cast a noncreature spell, Cunning Breezedancer gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

appearance.flavor: "That which is beautiful in form can also be deadly."\n—Ishai, Ojutai dragonspeaker

card.name: Custodian of the Trove
card.text: Defender\nCustodian of the Trove enters the battlefield tapped.

appearance.flavor: Silumgar delights in repurposing the treasures of other clans to serve his own ravenous greed.

card.name: Damnable Pact
card.text: Target player draws X cards and loses X life.

appearance.flavor: "Silumgar's mind is a dark labyrinth, full of grim secrets and subtle traps."\n—Siara, the Dragon's Mouth

card.name: Dance of the Skywise
card.text: Until end of turn, target creature you control becomes a blue Dragon Illusion with base power and toughness 4/4, loses all abilities, and gains flying.

appearance.flavor: The Ojutai believe in the Great Wheel: those who best serve the dragonlord are destined to be reborn as dragons.

card.name: Deadly Wanderings
card.text: As long as you control exactly one creature, that creature gets +2/+0 and has deathtouch and lifelink.

appearance.flavor: "Seclusion is only an option for the strong."\n—Sorin Markov

card.name: Death Wind
card.text: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn.

appearance.flavor: "I am a dragonslayer for Lord Silumgar. There is no dragon save him whom I fear."\n—Xathi the Infallible

card.name: Deathbringer Regent
card.text: Flying\nWhen Deathbringer Regent enters the battlefield, if you cast it from your hand and there are five or more other creatures on the battlefield, destroy all other creatures.

card.name: Deathmist Raptor
card.text: Deathtouch\nWhenever a permanent you control is turned face up, you may return Deathmist Raptor from your graveyard to the battlefield face up or face down.\nMegamorph {4}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

card.name: Defeat
card.text: Destroy target creature with power 2 or less.

appearance.flavor: "Wars are decided one life at a time."\n—Gvar Barzeel, Kolaghan warrior

card.name: Den Protector
card.text: Creatures with power less than Den Protector's power can't block it.\nMegamorph {1}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)\nWhen Den Protector is turned face up, return target card from your graveyard to your hand.

card.name: Descent of the Dragons
card.text: Destroy any number of target creatures. For each creature destroyed this way, its controller puts a 4/4 red Dragon creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

appearance.flavor: Dragons emerge from tempests fully formed and terribly hungry.

card.name: Dirgur Nemesis
card.text: Defender\nMegamorph {6}{U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

card.name: Display of Dominance
card.text: Choose one —\n• Destroy target blue or black noncreature permanent.\n• Permanents you control can't be the targets of blue or black spells your opponents control this turn.

card.name: Draconic Roar
card.text: As an additional cost to cast Draconic Roar, you may reveal a Dragon card from your hand.\nDraconic Roar deals 3 damage to target creature. If you revealed a Dragon card or controlled a Dragon as you cast Draconic Roar, Draconic Roar deals 3 damage to that creature's controller.

card.name: Dragon Fodder
card.text: Put two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield.

appearance.flavor: Atarka goblins meet their demise as readily as their Temur counterparts did, but usually under big, winged shadows.

card.name: Dragon Hunter
card.text: Protection from Dragons\nDragon Hunter can block Dragons as though it had reach.

appearance.flavor: "Dromoka has taught me the secrets of her kind, that I might use them in her service."

card.name: Dragon Tempest
card.text: Whenever a creature with flying enters the battlefield under your control, it gains haste until end of turn.\nWhenever a Dragon enters the battlefield under your control, it deals X damage to target creature or player, where X is the number of Dragons you control.

card.name: Dragon Whisperer
card.text: {R}: Dragon Whisperer gains flying until end of turn.\n{1}{R}: Dragon Whisperer gets +1/+0 until end of turn.\nFormidable — {4}{R}{R}: Put a 4/4 red Dragon creature token with flying onto the battlefield. Activate this ability only if creatures you control have total power 8 or greater.

card.name: Dragonloft Idol
card.text: As long as you control a Dragon, Dragonloft Idol gets +1/+1 and has flying and trample.

appearance.flavor: The idols were forged during the time of the Khanfall, when the dragons came to rule Tarkir and its people aligned themselves with the five dragonlords.

card.name: Dragonlord Atarka
card.text: Flying, trample\nWhen Dragonlord Atarka enters the battlefield, it deals 5 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or planeswalkers your opponents control.

card.name: Dragonlord Dromoka
card.text: Dragonlord Dromoka can't be countered.\nFlying, lifelink\nYour opponents can't cast spells during your turn.

appearance.flavor: Dromoka's followers forsake blood ties so that they may join a greater family.

card.name: Dragonlord Kolaghan
card.text: Flying, haste\nOther creatures you control have haste.\nWhenever an opponent casts a creature or planeswalker spell with the same name as a card in his or her graveyard, that player loses 10 life.

card.name: Dragonlord Ojutai
card.text: Flying\nDragonlord Ojutai has hexproof as long as it's untapped.\nWhenever Dragonlord Ojutai deals combat damage to a player, look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

card.name: Dragonlord Silumgar
card.text: Flying, deathtouch\nWhen Dragonlord Silumgar enters the battlefield, gain control of target creature or planeswalker for as long as you control Dragonlord Silumgar.

appearance.flavor: Silumgar never passes up an opportunity to add to his opulence.

card.name: Dragonlord's Prerogative
card.text: As an additional cost to cast Dragonlord's Prerogative, you may reveal a Dragon card from your hand.\nIf you revealed a Dragon card or controlled a Dragon as you cast Dragonlord's Prerogative, Dragonlord's Prerogative can't be countered.\nDraw four cards.

card.name: Dragonlord's Servant
card.text: Dragon spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

appearance.flavor: Atarka serving-goblins coat themselves with grease imbued with noxious herbs, hoping to discourage their ravenous masters from adding them to the meal.

card.name: Dragon's Eye Sentry
card.text: Defender, first strike

appearance.flavor: Even the humblest guard of Ojutai's strongholds ponders the puzzles of the Great Teacher's lessons.

card.name: Dragon-Scarred Bear
card.text: Formidable — {1}{G}: Regenerate Dragon-Scarred Bear. Activate this ability only if creatures you control have total power 8 or greater.

appearance.flavor: Bears are a delicacy for the Atarka. The few that remain are the toughest of their species.

card.name: Dromoka Captain
card.text: First strike\nWhenever Dromoka Captain attacks, bolster 1. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

appearance.flavor: "We fight not out of fear, but for honor."

card.name: Dromoka Dunecaster
card.text: {1}{W}, {T}: Tap target creature without flying.

appearance.flavor: "The dragonlords rule the tempests of the skies. Here in the wastes, the storms are mine to command."

card.name: Dromoka Monument
card.text: {T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool.\n{4}{G}{W}: Dromoka Monument becomes a 4/4 green and white Dragon artifact creature with flying until end of turn.

appearance.flavor: Dromoka rules her clan from the Great Aerie atop Arashin, the central city of the Shifting Wastes.
Dromoka has regard for the humans who serve under her. In return for her protection, they obey with steadfast loyalty, acting as weapons for her and her scalelords against the other clans.

card.name: Dromoka's Command
card.text:
Choose two —
• Prevent all damage target instant or sorcery spell would deal this turn.
• Target player sacrifices an enchantment.
• Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
• Target creature you control fights target creature you don't control.

card.name: Dromoka's Gift
card.text: Bolster 4. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put four +1/+1 counters on it.)

appearance.flavor: The simplest gift from a dragon can be a revered accolade for a human warrior.

card.name: Duress
card.text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.

appearance.flavor: Sarkhan was eager to take vengeance on Zurgo until he saw how lowly his old foe had become.

card.name: Dutiful Attendant
card.text: When Dutiful Attendant dies, return another target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

appearance.flavor: The dragon who eats the last head in the basket is entitled to the servant's.

card.name: Echoes of the Kin Tree
card.text: {2}{W}: Bolster 1. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

appearance.flavor: Even after Anafenza was executed, many secretly maintained their beliefs in the old ways.

card.name: Elusive Spellfist
card.text: Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, Elusive Spellfist gets +1/+0 until end of turn and can't be blocked this turn.

appearance.flavor: "Learn to see an obstacle from a new perspective. Underneath, for example."\n—Chanyi, Ojutai monk

card.name: Encase in Ice
card.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Enchant red or green creature
When Encase in Ice enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

card.name: Enduring Scalelord
card.text: Flying\nWhenever one or more +1/+1 counters are placed on another creature you control, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Enduring Scalelord.

appearance.flavor: Only the sun that beats down upon Arashin's walls could shine more brightly.

card.name: Enduring Victory
card.text: Destroy target attacking or blocking creature. Bolster 1. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

appearance.flavor: "My dragonlord is immortal. Most dragons are not."\n—Kadri, Dromoka warrior

card.name: Epic Confrontation
card.text: Target creature you control gets +1/+2 until end of turn. It fights target creature you don't control. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

appearance.flavor: No matter the timeline, some legends will endure.

card.name: Evolving Wilds
card.text: {T}, Sacrifice Evolving Wilds: Search your library for a basic land card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

appearance.flavor: The land is ever resilient. Should it die, it will be reborn.

card.name: Explosive Vegetation
card.text: Search your library for up to two basic land cards and put them onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

appearance.flavor: Despite the flames and devastation of the dragons, Tarkir continued to thrive.

card.name: Fate Forgotten
card.text: Exile target artifact or enchantment.

appearance.flavor: When Sarkhan saved Ugin in Tarkir's past, it changed Tarkir's future. The Sultai no longer exist, having been supplanted by the dragonlord Silumgar and his clan.

card.name: Flatten
card.text: Target creature gets -4/-4 until end of turn.

appearance.flavor: Like their dragonlord, the Kolaghan take no trophies. They find true fulfillment only in the battle itself, in clash of steel and thunder of hooves.

card.name: Foe-Razer Regent
card.text: Flying\nWhen Foe-Razer Regent enters the battlefield, you may have it fight target creature you don't control.\nWhenever a creature you control fights, put two +1/+1 counters on it at the beginning of the next end step.

card.name: Foul Renewal
card.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand. Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the toughness of the card returned this way.

appearance.flavor: The cycle of life and death is rarely pretty.

card.name: Foul-Tongue Invocation
card.text: As an additional cost to cast Foul-Tongue Invocation, you may reveal a Dragon card from your hand.\nTarget player sacrifices a creature. If you revealed a Dragon card or controlled a Dragon as you cast Foul-Tongue Invocation, you gain 4 life.

card.name: Foul-Tongue Shriek
card.text: Target opponent loses 1 life for each attacking creature you control. You gain that much life.

appearance.flavor: Foul-Tongue shamans draw their powers from a dark twisting of the Draconic language.

card.name: Gate Smasher
card.text: Gate Smasher can be attached only to a creature with toughness 4 or greater.\nEquipped creature gets +3/+0 and has trample.\nEquip {3}

card.name: Glade Watcher
card.text: Defender\nFormidable — {G}: Glade Watcher can attack this turn as though it didn't have defender. Activate this ability only if creatures you control have total power 8 or greater.

card.name: Glaring Aegis
card.text: Enchant creature\nWhen Glaring Aegis enters the battlefield, tap target creature an opponent controls.\nEnchanted creature gets +1/+3.

card.name: Gleam of Authority
card.text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each +1/+1 counter on other creatures you control.\nEnchanted creature has vigilance and "{W}, {T}: Bolster 1." (To bolster 1, choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

card.name: Glint
card.text: Target creature you control gets +0/+3 and gains hexproof until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

appearance.flavor: Rakshasa waste no opportunity to display their wealth and power, even in the midst of a sorcerous duel.

card.name: Graceblade Artisan
card.text: Graceblade Artisan gets +2/+2 for each Aura attached to it.

appearance.flavor: "Can you catch a snowflake on the edge of your blade? Her sword has snagged an entire blizzard."\n—Zogye, Ojutai mystic

card.name: Gravepurge
card.text: Put any number of target creature cards from your graveyard on top of your library.\nDraw a card.

appearance.flavor: "Lord Silumgar has given you a second chance to please him."\n—Siara, the Dragon's Mouth

card.name: Great Teacher's Decree
card.text: Creatures you control get +2/+1 until end of turn.\nRebound (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. At the beginning of your next upkeep, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

card.name: Guardian Shield-Bearer
card.text: Megamorph {3}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)\nWhen Guardian Shield-Bearer is turned face up, put a +1/+1 counter on another target creature you control.

card.name: Gudul Lurker
card.text: Gudul Lurker can't be blocked.\nMegamorph {U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

appearance.flavor: The small are mostly ignored by dragons.

card.name: Gurmag Drowner
card.text: Exploit (When this creature enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice a creature.)\nWhen Gurmag Drowner exploits a creature, look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.

card.name: Hand of Silumgar
card.text: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

appearance.flavor: Silumgar trains those whom he favors in his magic, granting them the ability to spread his disdain across the land.

card.name: Harbinger of the Hunt
card.text: Flying\n{2}{R}: Harbinger of the Hunt deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.\n{2}{G}: Harbinger of the Hunt deals 1 damage to each other creature with flying.

appearance.flavor: An Atarka dragon's exhale cooks what its inhale consumes.

card.name: Hardened Berserker
card.text: Whenever Hardened Berserker attacks, the next spell you cast this turn costs {1} less to cast.

appearance.flavor: "Just let him loose and follow the charge."\n—Yikaro, Atarka warrior

card.name: Haven of the Spirit Dragon
card.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.\n{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast a Dragon creature spell.\n{2}, {T}, Sacrifice Haven of the Spirit Dragon: Return target Dragon creature card or Ugin planeswalker card from your graveyard to your hand.

card.name: Hedonist's Trove
card.text: When Hedonist's Trove enters the battlefield, exile all cards from target opponent's graveyard.\nYou may play land cards exiled with Hedonist's Trove.\nYou may cast nonland cards exiled with Hedonist's Trove. You can't cast more than one spell this way each turn.

card.name: Herald of Dromoka
card.text: Vigilance\nOther Warrior creatures you control have vigilance.

appearance.flavor: The trumpeters of Arashin are ever alert in their watch over the Great Aerie.

card.name: Herdchaser Dragon
card.text: Flying, trample\nMegamorph {5}{G}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)\nWhen Herdchaser Dragon is turned face up, put a +1/+1 counter on each other Dragon creature you control.

card.name: Hidden Dragonslayer
card.text: Lifelink\nMegamorph {2}{W} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)\nWhen Hidden Dragonslayer is turned face up, destroy target creature with power 4 or greater an opponent controls.

card.name: Icefall Regent
card.text: Flying\nWhen Icefall Regent enters the battlefield, tap target creature an opponent controls. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as you control Icefall Regent. \nSpells your opponents cast that target Icefall Regent cost {2} more to cast.

card.name: Illusory Gains
card.text: Enchant creature\nYou control enchanted creature.\nWhenever a creature enters the battlefield under an opponent's control, attach Illusory Gains to that creature.

card.name: Impact Tremors
card.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, Impact Tremors deals 1 damage to each opponent.

appearance.flavor: "If their ears are to the ground, we will make them bleed!"\n—Taklai, Kolaghan warrior

card.name: Inspiring Call
card.text: Draw a card for each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it. Those creatures gain indestructible until end of turn. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy them.)

card.name: Ire Shaman
card.text: Ire Shaman can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.\nMegamorph {R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)\nWhen Ire Shaman is turned face up, exile the top card of your library. Until end of turn, you may play that card.

card.name: Keeper of the Lens
card.text: You may look at face-down creatures you don't control. (You may do this at any time.)

appearance.flavor: "It sees all, but it reveals what it sees only to a chosen few."\n—Taigam, Ojutai master

card.name: Kindled Fury
card.text: Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.

appearance.flavor: "It is most honorable to use every part of the animals we kill . . . especially if we use them to annihilate our enemies."\n—Surrak, the Hunt Caller

card.name: Kolaghan Aspirant
card.text: Whenever Kolaghan Aspirant becomes blocked by a creature, Kolaghan Aspirant deals 1 damage to that creature.

appearance.flavor: She answers the call of the Crave, the desire for battle sated only by bloodshed.

card.name: Kolaghan Forerunners
card.text: Trample\nKolaghan Forerunners's power is equal to the number of creatures you control.\nDash {2}{R} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)

card.name: Kolaghan Monument
card.text: {T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool.\n{4}{B}{R}: Kolaghan Monument becomes a 4/4 black and red Dragon artifact creature with flying until end of turn.

appearance.flavor: Kolaghan has no lasting home, but her disciples leave relics to mark her conquests.

card.name: Kolaghan Skirmisher
card.text: Dash {2}{B} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)

appearance.flavor: Kolaghan's army rushes from kill to kill, desperate to avoid the dragon's wrath.

card.name: Kolaghan Stormsinger
card.text: Haste\nMegamorph {R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)\nWhen Kolaghan Stormsinger is turned face up, target creature gains haste until end of turn.

card.name: Kolaghan's Command
card.text:
Choose two —
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Target player discards a card.
• Destroy target artifact.
• Kolaghan's Command deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

card.name: Learn from the Past
card.text: Target player shuffles his or her graveyard into his or her library.\nDraw a card.

appearance.flavor: "I've been told my whole life that the great Ojutai holds all knowledge, but I wonder what our forebears knew."\n—Narset

card.name: Lightning Berserker
card.text: {R}: Lightning Berserker gets +1/+0 until end of turn.\nDash {R} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)

card.name: Lightwalker
card.text: Lightwalker has flying as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.

appearance.flavor: "The greatest gift Dromoka gives is the ability to fly without wings."\n—Urdnan, Dromoka warrior

card.name: Living Lore
card.text: As Living Lore enters the battlefield, exile an instant or sorcery card from your graveyard.\nLiving Lore's power and toughness are each equal to the exiled card's converted mana cost.\nWhenever Living Lore deals combat damage, you may sacrifice it. If you do, you may cast the exiled card without paying its mana cost.

card.name: Lose Calm
card.text: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn and can't be blocked this turn except by two or more creatures.

appearance.flavor: A lifetime of discipline forsaken in a moment of rage.

card.name: Lurking Arynx
card.text: Formidable — {2}{G}: Target creature blocks Lurking Arynx this turn if able. Activate this ability only if creatures you control have total power 8 or greater.

appearance.flavor: Once it has your scent, it will hunt you from the Gurmag Swamp to Ayagor.

card.name: Magmatic Chasm
card.text: Creatures without flying can't block this turn.

appearance.flavor: "Our shamans assert their mastery over the land, thwarting the lesser clans' attempts to stand in the way of our dragonlord."\n—Allek, Atarka hunter

card.name: Marang River Skeleton
card.text: {B}: Regenerate Marang River Skeleton.\nMegamorph {3}{B} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

appearance.flavor: The gurgling of the Marang conceals both footsteps and screams.

card.name: Marsh Hulk
card.text: Megamorph {6}{B} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

appearance.flavor: Now vengeance is his sole purpose.

card.name: Mind Rot
card.text: Target player discards two cards.

appearance.flavor: "The Ojutai are my favorite victims. They have so much knowledge to lose."\n—Asmala, Silumgar sorcerer

card.name: Minister of Pain
card.text: Exploit (When this creature enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice a creature.)\nWhen Minister of Pain exploits a creature, creatures your opponents control get -1/-1 until end of turn.

appearance.flavor: Draconic words need not be shouted. A whisper will suffice.

card.name: Mirror Mockery
card.text: Enchant creature\nWhenever enchanted creature attacks, you may put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of that creature. Exile that token at end of combat.

appearance.flavor: Who you are constantly runs toward who you will be.

card.name: Misthoof Kirin
card.text: Flying, vigilance\nMegamorph {1}{W} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

appearance.flavor: It heralded Sarkhan's return to Tarkir's present.

card.name: Monastery Loremaster
card.text: Megamorph {5}{U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)\nWhen Monastery Loremaster is turned face up, return target noncreature, nonland card from your graveyard to your hand.

card.name: Mystic Meditation
card.text: Draw three cards. Then discard two cards unless you discard a creature card.

appearance.flavor: "Still the mind and quiet the heart. Only then will you hear the Multiverse's great truths."\n—Narset

card.name: Myth Realized
card.text: Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, put a lore counter on Myth Realized.\n{2}{W}: Put a lore counter on Myth Realized.\n{W}: Until end of turn, Myth Realized becomes a Monk Avatar creature in addition to its other types and gains "This creature's power and toughness are each equal to the number of lore counters on it."

card.name: Narset Transcendent
card.text: +1: Look at the top card of your library. If it's a noncreature, nonland card, you may reveal it and put it into your hand.\n-2: When you cast your next instant or sorcery spell from your hand this turn, it gains rebound.\n-9: You get an emblem with "Your opponents can't cast noncreature spells."

card.name: Naturalize
card.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

appearance.flavor: The remains of ancient civilizations litter the run-down land.

card.name: Necromaster Dragon
card.text: Flying\nWhenever Necromaster Dragon deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}. If you do, put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield and each opponent puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

card.name: Negate
card.text: Counter target noncreature spell.

appearance.flavor: "You cannot be an Ojutai monk. They prize wisdom and skill, and you have neither."\n—Siara, the Dragon's Mouth

card.name: Obscuring Æther
card.text: Face-down creature spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.\n{1}{G}: Turn Obscuring Æther face down. (It becomes a 2/2 creature.)

card.name: Ojutai Exemplars
card.text:
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, choose one —
• Tap target creature.
• Ojutai Exemplars gains first strike and lifelink until end of turn.
• Exile Ojutai Exemplars, then return it to the battlefield tapped under its owner's control.

card.name: Ojutai Interceptor
card.text: Flying\nMegamorph {3}{U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

appearance.flavor: "Though I may soar, I could never fly as high as the dragons."

card.name: Ojutai Monument
card.text: {T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool.\n{4}{W}{U}: Ojutai Monument becomes a 4/4 white and blue Dragon artifact creature with flying until end of turn.

appearance.flavor: Ojutai spends time at all his strongholds, but he most favors Cori Stronghold for his meditation.

card.name: Ojutai's Breath
card.text: Tap target creature. It doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.\nRebound (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. At the beginning of your next upkeep, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

card.name: Ojutai's Command
card.text:
Choose two —
• Return target creature card with converted mana cost 2 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.
• You gain 4 life.
• Counter target creature spell.
• Draw a card.

card.name: Ojutai's Summons
card.text: Put a 2/2 blue Djinn Monk creature token with flying onto the battlefield.\nRebound (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. At the beginning of your next upkeep, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

card.name: Orator of Ojutai
card.text: As an additional cost to cast Orator of Ojutai, you may reveal a Dragon card from your hand.\nDefender, flying\nWhen Orator of Ojutai enters the battlefield, if you revealed a Dragon card or controlled a Dragon as you cast Orator of Ojutai, draw a card.

card.name: Pacifism
card.text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature can't attack or block.

appearance.flavor: "If I fight, I might step on a butterfly. That would be sad."\n—Krowg of Qal Sisma

card.name: Palace Familiar
card.text: Flying\nWhen Palace Familiar dies, draw a card.

appearance.flavor: "The most profound secrets lie in the darkest places of the world. It can be prudent to make use of another set of eyes."\n—Sidisi, Silumgar vizier

card.name: Pinion Feast
card.text: Destroy target creature with flying. Bolster 2. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put two +1/+1 counters on it.)

appearance.flavor: "Even paradise is not without tragedies."\n—Sarkhan Vol

card.name: Pitiless Horde
card.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 2 life.\nDash {2}{B}{B} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)

card.name: Press the Advantage
card.text: Up to two target creatures each get +2/+2 and gain trample until end of turn.

appearance.flavor: "Show your enemies as much mercy as they would show you."\n—Surrak, the Hunt Caller

card.name: Pristine Skywise
card.text: Flying\nWhenever you cast a noncreature spell, untap Pristine Skywise. It gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.

appearance.flavor: The elite of Ojutai's brood, the skywise see their enemies as puzzles to be solved.

card.name: Profaner of the Dead
card.text: Exploit (When this creature enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice a creature.)\nWhen Profaner of the Dead exploits a creature, return to their owners' hands all creatures your opponents control with toughness less than the exploited creature's toughness.

card.name: Profound Journey
card.text: Return target permanent card from your graveyard to the battlefield.\nRebound (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. At the beginning of your next upkeep, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

card.name: Qal Sisma Behemoth
card.text: Qal Sisma Behemoth can't attack or block unless you pay {2}.

appearance.flavor: "It hunts grand game for Atarka, and when the time comes, it will become a mighty feast."\n—Surrak, the Hunt Caller

card.name: Qarsi Deceiver
card.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast a face-down creature spell, pay a mana cost to turn a manifested creature face up, or pay a morph cost. (A megamorph cost is a morph cost.)

card.name: Qarsi Sadist
card.text: Exploit (When this creature enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice a creature.)\nWhen Qarsi Sadist exploits a creature, target opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.

appearance.flavor: Dying for the greater good still hurts.

card.name: Radiant Purge
card.text: Exile target multicolored creature or multicolored enchantment.

appearance.flavor: The Shifting Wastes are Dromoka's domain. She will not tolerate intruders.

card.name: Rakshasa Gravecaller
card.text: Exploit (When this creature enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice a creature.)\nWhen Rakshasa Gravecaller exploits a creature, put two 2/2 black Zombie creature tokens onto the battlefield.

appearance.flavor: Debts to rakshasa linger beyond death.

card.name: Reckless Imp
card.text: Flying\nReckless Imp can't block.\nDash {1}{B} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)

card.name: Reduce in Stature
card.text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature has base power and toughness 0/2.

appearance.flavor: A dragon learns humility only in the moments before its death.

card.name: Rending Volley
card.text: Rending Volley can't be countered by spells or abilities.\nRending Volley deals 4 damage to target white or blue creature.

appearance.flavor: The sky offers few hiding places.

card.name: Resupply
card.text: You gain 6 life.\nDraw a card.

appearance.flavor: "If the scalelords are the brains of Dromoka's army, the supply caravans are its beating heart."\n—Baihir, Dromoka mage

card.name: Revealing Wind
card.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn. You may look at each face-down creature that's attacking or blocking.

appearance.flavor: "The sands obscure the vision of others, but clarify ours."\n—Faiso, Dromoka commander

card.name: Risen Executioner
card.text: Risen Executioner can't block.\nOther Zombie creatures you control get +1/+1.\nYou may cast Risen Executioner from your graveyard if you pay {1} more to cast it for each other creature card in your graveyard.

card.name: Roast
card.text: Roast deals 5 damage to target creature without flying.

appearance.flavor: "Intruders in the lands of Atarka have but two choices: be consumed by fire, or be consumed by maw."\n—Ulnok, Atarka shaman

card.name: Ruthless Deathfang
card.text: Flying\nWhenever you sacrifice a creature, target opponent sacrifices a creature.

appearance.flavor: "Bring forth the dead, their skull-grins and rattle-bones. We will feast upon their wailing ghosts."\n—Silumgar, translated from Draconic

card.name: Sabertooth Outrider
card.text: Trample\nFormidable — Whenever Sabertooth Outrider attacks, if creatures you control have total power 8 or greater, Sabertooth Outrider gains first strike until end of turn.

card.name: Salt Road Ambushers
card.text: Whenever another permanent you control is turned face up, if it's a creature, put two +1/+1 counters on it.\nMegamorph {3}{G}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

card.name: Salt Road Quartermasters
card.text: Salt Road Quartermasters enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.\n{2}{G}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Salt Road Quartermasters: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

card.name: Sandcrafter Mage
card.text: When Sandcrafter Mage enters the battlefield, bolster 1. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

appearance.flavor: With heat, sand can form a delicate work of art; with pressure, an impenetrable bulwark.

card.name: Sandsteppe Scavenger
card.text: When Sandsteppe Scavenger enters the battlefield, bolster 2. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put two +1/+1 counters on it.)

appearance.flavor: "Sad what passes for a dragon among the Silumgar."

card.name: Sandstorm Charger
card.text: Megamorph {4}{W} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

appearance.flavor: "May our foes choke upon its horns!"\n—Urdnan, Dromoka warrior

card.name: Sarkhan Unbroken
card.text: +1: Draw a card, then add one mana of any color to your mana pool.\n-2: Put a 4/4 red Dragon creature token with flying onto the battlefield.\n-8: Search your library for any number of Dragon creature cards and put them onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

card.name: Sarkhan's Rage
card.text: Sarkhan's Rage deals 5 damage to target creature or player. If you control no Dragons, Sarkhan's Rage deals 2 damage to you.

appearance.flavor: The people of Tarkir speak of an ancient legend, of the dragon-man called Sarkhan who was greatest of all khans.

card.name: Sarkhan's Triumph
card.text: Search your library for a Dragon creature card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

appearance.flavor: Sarkhan gazed on the world around him, the dragons sweeping through its skies, and joy kindled like a fire in his soul.

card.name: Savage Ventmaw
card.text: Flying\nWhenever Savage Ventmaw attacks, add {R}{R}{R}{G}{G}{G} to your mana pool. Until end of turn, this mana doesn't empty from your mana pool as steps and phases end.

card.name: Scale Blessing
card.text: Bolster 1, then put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it. (To bolster 1, choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

appearance.flavor: "Your bravery honors us all."\n—Dromoka, translated from Draconic

card.name: Scaleguard Sentinels
card.text: As an additional cost to cast Scaleguard Sentinels, you may reveal a Dragon card from your hand.\nScaleguard Sentinels enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it if you revealed a Dragon card or controlled a Dragon as you cast Scaleguard Sentinels.

appearance.flavor: For hundreds of years Ugin slept, encased in the cocoon of stone and magic Sarkhan had created using a shard of a Zendikari hedron. As Ugin lay dormant, his spectral guardians kept vigil.

card.name: Screamreach Brawler
card.text: Dash {1}{R} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)

appearance.flavor: "My dragonlord's lightning will dance upon your bones!"

card.name: Secure the Wastes
card.text: Put X 1/1 white Warrior creature tokens onto the battlefield.

appearance.flavor: "The Shifting Wastes provide our clan eternal protection. It is our duty to return the favor."\n—Kadri, Dromoka warrior

card.name: Segmented Krotiq
card.text: Megamorph {6}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

appearance.flavor: The list of things a krotiq eats is as long as the krotiq itself.

card.name: Seismic Rupture
card.text: Seismic Rupture deals 2 damage to each creature without flying.

appearance.flavor: The shaman opened the earth beneath their feet, trapping the survivors within the crevices of Ayagor for Atarka to devour at her leisure.

card.name: Self-Inflicted Wound
card.text: Target opponent sacrifices a green or white creature. If that player does, he or she loses 2 life.

appearance.flavor: "Worse than watching the cruelest deed is watching it done by your own hand."\n—Baihir, Dromoka mage

card.name: Servant of the Scale
card.text: Servant of the Scale enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.\nWhen Servant of the Scale dies, put X +1/+1 counters on target creature you control, where X is the number of +1/+1 counters on Servant of the Scale.

card.name: Shaman of Forgotten Ways
card.text: {T}: Add two mana in any combination of colors to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast creature spells.\nFormidable — {9}{G}{G}, {T}: Each player's life total becomes the number of creatures he or she controls. Activate this ability only if creatures you control have total power 8 or greater.

card.name: Shambling Goblin
card.text: When Shambling Goblin dies, target creature an opponent controls gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

appearance.flavor: "The Kolaghan send them at us. We kill and raise them. They fight the next wave the Kolaghan send. It's a neat little cycle."\n—Asmala, Silumgar sorcerer

card.name: Shape the Sands
card.text: Target creature gets +0/+5 and gains reach until end of turn. (It can block creatures with flying.)

appearance.flavor: "Dragons in flight seldom expect company."\n—Kadri, Dromoka warrior

card.name: Sheltered Aerie
card.text: Enchant land\nEnchanted land has "{T}: Add two mana of any one color to your mana pool."

appearance.flavor: Dromoka's scalelords patrol the skies over Arashin, offering her people safety from the harsh world.

card.name: Shieldhide Dragon
card.text: Flying, lifelink\nMegamorph {5}{W}{W} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)\nWhen Shieldhide Dragon is turned face up, put a +1/+1 counter on each other Dragon creature you control.

card.name: Shorecrasher Elemental
card.text: {U}: Exile Shorecrasher Elemental, then return it to the battlefield face down under its owner's control.\n{1}: Shorecrasher Elemental gets +1/-1 or -1/+1 until end of turn. \nMegamorph {4}{U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

card.name: Sibsig Icebreakers
card.text: When Sibsig Icebreakers enters the battlefield, each player discards a card.

appearance.flavor: "I almost envy them. They can't get frostbite."\n—Kirada, Silumgar enforcer

card.name: Sidisi, Undead Vizier
card.text: Deathtouch\nExploit (When this creature enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice a creature.)\nWhen Sidisi, Undead Vizier exploits a creature, you may search your library for a card, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

card.name: Sidisi's Faithful
card.text: Exploit (When this creature enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice a creature.)\nWhen Sidisi's Faithful exploits a creature, return target creature to its owner's hand.

appearance.flavor: "I tire of your prattle, and your face."

card.name: Sight Beyond Sight
card.text: Look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other on the bottom of your library.\nRebound (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. At the beginning of your next upkeep, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

card.name: Sight of the Scalelords
card.text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, creatures you control with toughness 4 or greater get +2/+2 and gain vigilance until end of turn.

appearance.flavor: "The Silumgar creep around our borders and infiltrate our aeries. We must remain ever watchful."\n—Golran, Dromoka captain

card.name: Silkwrap
card.text: When Silkwrap enters the battlefield, exile target creature with converted mana cost 3 or less an opponent controls until Silkwrap leaves the battlefield. (That creature returns under its owner's control.)

appearance.flavor: Better scarves than scars.

card.name: Silumgar Assassin
card.text: Creatures with power greater than Silumgar Assassin's power can't block it.\nMegamorph {2}{B} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)\nWhen Silumgar Assassin is turned face up, destroy target creature with power 3 or less an opponent controls.

card.name: Silumgar Butcher
card.text: Exploit (When this creature enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice a creature.)\nWhen Silumgar Butcher exploits a creature, target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn.

appearance.flavor: Silumgar takes pride in the diversity of his sibsig.

card.name: Silumgar Monument
card.text: {T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool.\n{4}{U}{B}: Silumgar Monument becomes a 4/4 blue and black Dragon artifact creature with flying until end of turn.

appearance.flavor: Silumgar dominates his clan from a fortress on the Marang River, where he rests upon piles of treasure.

card.name: Silumgar Sorcerer
card.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Flying
Exploit (When this creature enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice a creature.)
When Silumgar Sorcerer exploits a creature, counter target creature spell.

card.name: Silumgar Spell-Eater
card.text: Megamorph {4}{U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)\nWhen Silumgar Spell-Eater is turned face up, counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.

card.name: Silumgar's Command
card.text:
Choose two —
• Counter target noncreature spell.
• Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
• Target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn.
• Destroy target planeswalker.

card.name: Silumgar's Scorn
card.text: As an additional cost to cast Silumgar's Scorn, you may reveal a Dragon card from your hand.\nCounter target spell unless its controller pays {1}. If you revealed a Dragon card or controlled a Dragon as you cast Silumgar's Scorn, counter that spell instead.

card.name: Skywise Teachings
card.text: Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, you may pay {1}{U}. If you do, put a 2/2 blue Djinn Monk creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

appearance.flavor: Ojutai's words must be translated from Draconic before his students can benefit from their wisdom.

card.name: Spidersilk Net
card.text: Equipped creature gets +0/+2 and has reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)\nEquip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

appearance.flavor: "Dragons are our betters, but we will fight them if our dragonlord orders it."

card.name: Sprinting Warbrute
card.text: Sprinting Warbrute attacks each turn if able.\nDash {3}{R} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)

card.name: Stampeding Elk Herd
card.text: Formidable — Whenever Stampeding Elk Herd attacks, if creatures you control have total power 8 or greater, creatures you control gain trample until end of turn.

appearance.flavor: The Atarka use them not just for food, but also to clear away snow, trees, and enemy forces.

card.name: Stormcrag Elemental
card.text: Trample\nMegamorph {4}{R}{R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

appearance.flavor: The storms of Tarkir awaken more than dragons.

card.name: Stormrider Rig
card.text: Equipped creature gets +1/+1.\nWhenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may attach Stormrider Rig to it.\nEquip {2}

card.name: Stormwing Dragon
card.text: Flying, first strike\nMegamorph {5}{R}{R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)\nWhen Stormwing Dragon is turned face up, put a +1/+1 counter on each other Dragon creature you control.

card.name: Stratus Dancer
card.text: Flying\nMegamorph {1}{U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)\nWhen Stratus Dancer is turned face up, counter target instant or sorcery spell.

card.name: Strongarm Monk
card.text: Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

appearance.flavor: "His companions are wise to follow him, for his foes dare not stand in his way."\n—Zhiada, Dirgur protector

card.name: Student of Ojutai
card.text: Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, you gain 2 life.

appearance.flavor: "Human enlightenment is a firefly that sparks in the night. Dragon enlightenment is a beacon that disperses all darkness."
"Do you not hunt the yetis of the high peaks, stripling? Their meat is as tender as a bear's and their blood as warming as fire. They are prey that will please Atarka."\n—Surrak, the Hunt Caller

card.name: Sunbringer's Touch
card.text: Bolster X, where X is the number of cards in your hand. Each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it gains trample until end of turn. (To bolster X, choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put X +1/+1 counters on it.)

card.name: Sunscorch Regent
card.text: Flying\nWhenever an opponent casts a spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Sunscorch Regent and you gain 1 life.

appearance.flavor: "We trust in the scalelords, bringers of justice that none can escape."\n—Urdnan, Dromoka warrior

card.name: Surge of Righteousness
card.text: Destroy target black or red creature that's attacking or blocking. You gain 2 life.

appearance.flavor: Though she stood alone, she struck with the force of an army.

card.name: Surrak, the Hunt Caller
card.text: Formidable — At the beginning of combat on your turn, if creatures you control have total power 8 or greater, target creature you control gains haste until end of turn.

appearance.flavor: "The greatest honor is to feed Atarka."

card.name: Swift Warkite
card.text: Flying\nWhen Swift Warkite enters the battlefield, you may put a creature card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your hand or graveyard onto the battlefield. That creature gains haste. Return it to your hand at the beginning of the next end step.

card.name: Taigam's Strike
card.text: Target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn and can't be blocked this turn.\nRebound (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. At the beginning of your next upkeep, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

card.name: Tail Slash
card.text: Target creature you control deals damage equal to its power to target creature you don't control.

appearance.flavor: "Kneel before a dragon and you will be spared when it turns to leave."\n—Yikaro, Atarka warrior

card.name: Tapestry of the Ages
card.text: {2}, {T}: Draw a card. Activate this ability only if you've cast a noncreature spell this turn.

appearance.flavor: "Abzan, Jeskai, Sultai, Mardu, Temur—names lost to history, yet worthy of further study."\n—Narset
"Such lesser creatures must be purged from the sky. What use do they have but to help channel the lightning of our mighty dragonlord?"\n—Gvar Barzeel, Kolaghan warrior

card.name: Thunderbreak Regent
card.text: Flying\nWhenever a Dragon you control becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, Thunderbreak Regent deals 3 damage to that player.

appearance.flavor: Attracting a dragon's attention may be the last mistake you make.

card.name: Tormenting Voice
card.text: As an additional cost to cast Tormenting Voice, discard a card.\nDraw two cards.

appearance.flavor: A mocking laughter echoed in Ugin's mind. How many centuries had he slumbered, stricken, while Nicol Bolas moved unchallenged among the planes?

card.name: Tread Upon
card.text: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains trample until end of turn.

appearance.flavor: "Boasting impenetrable defenses only draws the most tenacious of attackers."\n—Yikaro, Atarka warrior

card.name: Twin Bolt
card.text: Twin Bolt deals 2 damage divided as you choose among one or two target creatures and/or players.

appearance.flavor: Kolaghan archers are trained in Dakla, the way of the bow. They utilize their dragonlord's lightning to strike their target, no matter how small, how fast, or how far away.
"The Silumgar hide behind the deadly wildlife of their swamps. They'd rather scheme in their jungle palaces than face us."\n—Khibat, Kolaghan warrior

card.name: Ultimate Price
card.text: Destroy target monocolored creature.

appearance.flavor: "The realization that one is dying is far more terrifying than death itself."\n—Sidisi, Silumgar vizier
"It slips through the smallest cracks in the mountain, emerging whole and unfettered. There is nowhere it cannot go, for what can hold back the air itself?"\n—Chanyi, Ojutai monk

card.name: Vandalize
card.text: Choose one or both —\n• Destroy target artifact.\n• Destroy target land.

appearance.flavor: "As we have learned from Kolaghan, to ruin is to rule."\n—Shensu, Kolaghan rider

card.name: Vial of Dragonfire
card.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Vial of Dragonfire: Vial of Dragonfire deals 2 damage to target creature.

appearance.flavor: Designed by an ancient artificer, the vials are strong enough to hold the very breath of a dragon—until it's needed.

card.name: Virulent Plague
card.text: Creature tokens get -2/-2.

appearance.flavor: "This pestilence robs us of glorious death in battle. We starve to death with full bellies and drown trying to slake our unnatural thirst."\n—Kerai Hatesinger, Kolaghan warrior

card.name: Void Squall
card.text: Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand.\nRebound (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. At the beginning of your next upkeep, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

card.name: Volcanic Rush
card.text: Attacking creatures get +2/+0 and gain trample until end of turn.

appearance.flavor: "The bravest warriors take the shortest path to victory, whatever that path may be."\n—Sakta, Atarka hunter

card.name: Volcanic Vision
card.text: Return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand. Volcanic Vision deals damage equal to that card's converted mana cost to each creature your opponents control. Exile Volcanic Vision.

card.name: Vulturous Aven
card.text: Flying\nExploit (When this creature enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice a creature.)\nWhen Vulturous Aven exploits a creature, you draw two cards and you lose 2 life.

appearance.flavor: The crumbling temples on the tortoise's back are monuments to the decadence of the ancient Sultai. Though it harkens back to the era of the khans, Silumgar allows it to walk his territory as a warning to those who would oppose him.

card.name: Warbringer
card.text: Dash costs you pay cost {2} less (as long as this creature is on the battlefield).\nDash {2}{R} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)

card.name: Youthful Scholar
card.text: When Youthful Scholar dies, draw two cards.

appearance.flavor: "Too dumb, and you end up a sibsig. Too smart, and you end up a meal. Mediocrity is the key to a long life."\n—Mogai, Silumgar noble

card.name: Zephyr Scribe
card.text: {U}, {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.\nWhenever you cast a noncreature spell, untap Zephyr Scribe.

appearance.flavor: "Ojutai's rule has allowed Tarkir's monks to learn from the truly enlightened."\n—Sarkhan Vol

card.name: Zurgo Bellstriker
card.text: Zurgo Bellstriker can't block creatures with power 2 or greater.\nDash {1}{R} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)
